pins.name: Ashland Building
pins.description:
The Ashland Fire and Safety Laboratory houses our fire and safety programs, including fire protection administration; fire, arson and explosion investigation; and fire protection and safety engineering technology.

The Ashland Building is home to a fire protection system lab, fire extinguisher service lab and a multi-purpose high-bay lab.

The newest addition is a seven-room test burn facility.

pins.name: Burrier Building
pins.description:
The Burrier Building, located on the corner of University Drive and Crabbe Street, is home to the Departments of Family and Consumer Sciences Education, Child and Family Studies, and Food and Nutrition.

Burrier also houses the Burrier Cafe and the Burrier Child Development Center.

pins.name: Business and Technology Center
pins.description:
The Business & Technology Center is home to EKU’s College of Business.

We are one of the select few universities in the nation to house an AACSB-accredited School of Business along with an array of applied sciences programs, making diversity our competitive advantage.

The BTC is home to programs in high-demand career fields.

transcripts.transcript:
The College of Business is a great family environment. We want to make sure as professors that we're setting the students up for success. And I think we do this in a number of different ways. The first is our small classroom size. Students are able to interract with their professors and learn about different internship opportunities, careers, different fields they can go into after they graduate with a Business degree at EKU. 

One of the major benefits about the College of Business is we've got a wide variety of different concentrations. With 50% of all college graduates going into the field of sales, this provides them an opportunity to have that foundation of personal selling, marketing principles, sales management, and other sales-related courses to be successful in that commission-based role.

The PGA Golf Management Program is a very unique program. There's only 18 PGA accredited universities in the country that are accredited by the PGA of America. And we're very fortunate to have our program here at Eastern Kentucky University. Students are earning a Bachelor's of Business Administration with a concentration in PGA Golf Management. 

Students in our program they go on to run a golf operation in the sense of being a PGA Head Professional, Assistant Professional or General Manager. They can also do a lot of other things which involve club repair, tournament operations, teaching, coaching, so there's a lot of different career aspects. 

There's so many things that EKU has to offer, and I believe getting involved on campus is a great way to meet new people, but also expand your network as well as a student.

pins.name: Campbell Building
pins.description:
The Campbell Building is home to the Department of Art, EKU Theatre and the C.H. Gifford Theatre.

Inside Campbell, plays, concerts and musical productions are held in the 475-seat theatre.

Also found in the lobby of the Campbell Building is the Fred P. Giles Art Gallery.

pins.name: Carter Building
pins.description:
The A.B. Carter Building is home to EKU Agriculture, offering various degrees in agriculture and a pre-veterinary medicine program.

Modern facilities like the greenhouses and our very own Meadowbrook Farm provide hands-on learning experiences.

pins.name: Combs Building
pins.description:
The Combs Building is home to the Department of Education, public relations, and some broadcasting and electronic media courses.

Combs includes lecture-hall style classrooms, each built like a small auditorium.

Every hour during the regular semester, more than 2,000 students are in class here.

transcripts.transcript:
We have a Model Laboratory School it's a K through 12 school that's actually here on our campus. The Model School is something that you will not find really anywhere else. It is one of the last schools like that in the state and it's on our campus so I didn't have to worry about driving to it or anything like that. And it was just something super special to me that really drew me here to Eastern.

The ASLIE program is one of the top-notch programs in the US. We are fully accredited, and we offer various resources for the students and helping them acquire their language skills to serve the deaf community. For example, the "LLC" the Living Learning Community, which means that the students live on one given floor in the dorm and only use ASL for communication purposes. So that's different than other universities. We also offer a study abroad program. And we have traveled to Spain and various countries for study abroad. And then we are interacting with the deaf community and students there.

I definitely feel that the education program here has prepared me for my post-graduation plans. We've had a lot of hands-on experience as we go into the job field, the many projects, many extensive lesson plans, and all of that is just building everything up. If you're looking for a hands on experience that you know that you're going to love getting involved with students learning how to write lesson plans, and having the faculty to support you. That is what you're going to find here at Eastern Kentucky University.

pins.name: Crabbe Library
pins.description:
The Crabbe Library is sectioned by noise level and has many dynamic study areas to help meet each student’s individual needs – including our very own Student Success Center, a one-stop shop for EKU students.

The Noel Studio for Academic Creativity offers innovative support for communication, research, teaching and learning initiatives that enhance deep learning at EKU.

We don’t stop there.

There’s also a music library in the Foster Building and a library in our Business & Technology Center.

The Crabbe Library also hosts workshops for students and stays open 24/7 around finals.

transcripts.transcript:
The Student Success Center offers tutoring in over 200 classes. We offer mentoring for students either placed through a success agreement or just asking for a mentor to help them through their process. We also offer student workshops ranging anywhere from time management to study skills, note taking skills, how to deal with stress.

At the Counseling Center, we provide mental health care for all enrolled Eastern students. I think it's very important that the college offers the mental health services for students. When someone is suffering with a lot of symptoms of depression, of anxiety, and that's going to impact their academics too. And when someone is feeling at their best, when somebody has the mental resources to devote to their academics, they're going to do better, they're going to absorb more. 

The faculty are more than willing to help all students be successful. And they know that they can come to the Success Center and we will help them.

pins.name: Dizney Building
pins.description:
The Dizney Building is the center of the College of Health Sciences and home to our nationally ranked occupational therapy and nursing programs.

Students can also earn degrees in environmental health science, medical laboratory science, health services administration, and more.

pins.name: Forensic Crime Scene House
pins.description: The Forensic Crime Scene House is used primarily by Forensic Science students for hands on experience in the field.

pins.name: Foster Music Building
pins.description:
The Foster Music Building is named after the composer of "My Old Kentucky Home."

Its spaces range from practice rooms to studios to classrooms.

The School of Music presents more than 100 concerts annually, including ensemble, faculty and guest artist performances.

While the Music Department offers several degree options, you don’t have to be a part of the department to get involved with music on campus.

Fun fact! EKU’s Foster Music Camp held each summer for middle and high-school students is the second oldest music camp in the nation.

pins.name: McCreary Building
pins.description:
The McCreary Building, located by Turner Gate, is home to the Bobby Verdugo and Yoli Rios Bilingual Peer Mentor and Tutoring Center.

This center provides tutoring for languages and other subjects along with mentoring for students.

pins.name: Moberly Building
pins.description: Moberly is home to our two-time national champion football program, our national championship co-ed and all-girl cheerleading program, as well as our athletic training, exercise and sport science, and pre-physical therapy programs.

pins.name: Model Laboratory School
pins.description:
Model Laboratory School is one of the top K-12 schools in the state, which allows our education students to get into the classroom within their first semester.

Originally known as Eastern Kentucky State Teachers College, EKU owes its foundation to teaching.

In addition to elementary, middle and high school teaching programs, EKU is home to a nationally recognized American Sign Language program, an outstanding communication disorders curriculum, and an early childhood special education program.

pins.name: New Science Building
pins.description:
We’ve now come across EKU’s $130 million, 330,000 square-foot Science Building.

This state-of-the-art space houses the Departments of Chemistry, Biology, Geoscience, Physics, and Astronomy.

STEM majors can get unparalleled hands-on experience in top-notch laboratories and classrooms.

One of our premier programs, forensic science, is also in this building.

Established in 1974, it’s only one of 18 accredited programs in the country.

transcripts.transcript:
Here at the College of Science Technology Engineering Math, they're helping me prepare for my future career. As an Aviation major, it's gearing me toward being a Professional Pilot, the Aviation program here at Eastern Kentucky is, is really great. There's a lot of people who are driven like that is their passion. A lot of former pilots themselves teaching you, and they want to see you succeed. It's nice because it is a Part 141 operation. So instead of having to get 1,500 hours, before I'd be able to fly for an airline, I would be able to get hired at 1,000. And you leave with a restricted ATP.

STEM is really used in just about every career somebody would want to obtain. You have to have skills in math to do just about any career out there... Also in science. So we help to prepare students by giving them skills in the laboratory, as well in math in order to succeed. 

Faculty at EKU are very dedicated to student success. I think one of the reasons why is we see that passion for students to get an education to want to learn more to increase their knowledge base, and their passion actually ignites our passion in order to provide a more enhanced experience. And in doing that, we can work with students in the classroom, trying to really engage them to learn more about specific content, and also in a research laboratory setting. 

One of the crown jewels in EKU is our Forensic Science program. We offer Forensic Biology and Forensic Chemistry. Both are accredited by FEPAC, which is the crediting body a forensic science programs and having two programs actually accredited by FEPAC is a significant feat.

The affordability definitely drew me in because of its affordability EKU has granted me the opportunity to to get my writings and pursue a career that I want to.

pins.name: Roark Building
pins.description:
Built in 1909, the Roark Building was originally home to the Model Laboratory School at Eastern.

Today, the building houses the Departments of Earth Sciences, Geography and Planning, and the Dean’s Office for the College of Letters, Arts, and Social Sciences.

transcripts.transcript:
African and African American Studies program is housed in the College of Liberal Arts and Social Sciences and is a college that is very important in providing students with the knowledge to thrive in an interdisciplinary world. The African and African American Studies program trains students to function in a world that is becoming increasingly multicultural, increasingly diverse. It's important for you to have the skills, the tools to be able to deal with people who are different from you. People who speak a different language, have different culture, and different ways of perceiving life. 

These courses that students do in FFA, will provide them with a foundational knowledge about the contributions made by black people to human civilization. So it increases your global perspective. We're essentially training global citizens, and you have a group of faculty who are dedicated to the success of students who go out of their way to mentor students, both in the classroom and outside the classroom. 

And that is what I find very unique about EKU -- the willingness of the instructors to go extra mile and these are instructors from different cultural backgrounds, different countries with different ideologies, different ethnicities. So when you come to EKU, you're gonna get world-class education provided by world class instructors from different countries.

pins.name: Rowlett Building
pins.description:
The Rowlett Building is a three-story, 53,000-square-foot facility housing the Department of Associate Degree Nursing, the Department of Baccalaureate and Graduate Nursing, and the Health Professions Learning Resource Center.

Rowlett also houses a state-of-the-art simulation lab for all EKU allied health students to use and EKU’s Student Health Services Clinic.

transcripts.transcript:
The College of Health Science here at EKU encompasses a lot of different majors. We have the School of Nursing, Exercise and Sports Science. We have Environmental Health and Medical Lab Sciences. We like to say that public health -- while we're in the health field -- we try and keep people healthy, so they don't have to go to the nurse or to the doctor. We are all about educating people on how to stay healthy or get healthy. We are the epidemiologists who are tracking disease and figuring out how cases are being spread. We do a little bit of everything. That's kind of the beauty of public health.

The quality of education is excellent. I have some of the best professors and they really care about us. They will notice if doesn't seem like we're doing all right, and they'll come up to us and ask us, "What's going on? Is there anything I can help you with?" And if you just have a lot on your plate, if you talk to them, they are always there for you. I really have enjoyed being a part of this program.

pins.name: Stratton Building
pins.description:
The Stratton Building is home to EKU’s program of distinction, the College of Justice, Safety, and Military Science.

The School of Justice Studies offers majors in criminal justice, police studies, social justice studies and more.

Since 1972, the School of Safety, Security, and Emergency Management programs have been the first choice for students around the world.

Offering students options in homeland security, occupational safety, and emergency management, we graduate some of the country’s most in-demand safety and security professionals.

transcripts.transcript:
At the College of Justice Safety Military Sciences, the University's "Program of Distinction," meaning that it's really sort of a preeminent program, and it's certainly a preeminent program here in the region. So that's beyond just Kentucky. But in the multistate region, we have really tremendous programs speaking to almost every aspect of public safety, criminal justice, fire science, corrections, social justice, and then recently, we added military science to the ROTC program as part of our college as well. 

I think we really understand the challenges that veterans face, we're able to help them really get the most out of the benefits, we're able to be flexible with their schedules, we understand what it means to deploy and have the service obligations because most of the faculty in our college come from a public safety service or military background.

I didn't start out as a Criminal Justice major. So that was a big change. For me. I was worried, but it was honestly the best experience. Since I came into the college, everybody welcomed me with open arms. And everything was explained to me in great detail. And it was a very welcoming environment. And it has been for the past three years.

Really the most valuable education is the combination of theory and practice. Employers who are looking for people like paramedics, police officers, federal agents, are looking for people who really know how to do the actual tasks, but also understand why they're doing them. And all of our programs in the college really bring those two together. So when our students graduate, they're seen as being experienced, they've already been doing the things that they've been learning about, and they don't need such a steep learning curve to transition to the workplace. And employers really seem to like that.

I feel like the quality of education that I've received here has been phenomenal. I think that comes from a lot of the professors and their willingness to not only help you but their drive to want to see you succeed as much as you want to see yourself succeed. Any problem I've ever had a professor has been more than willing to do whatever I need for my own success but also as a successful individual after college too.

pins.name: University Building
pins.description:
The University Building, also known as Old Central, is the oldest building on campus and is listed in the National Register of Historic Places.

It now houses the offices and classrooms for the Department of History, the EKU Honors Program, and is part of the Library’s new addition.

pins.name: Wallace Building
pins.description:
The Wallace Building, located conveniently to Case Dining Hall, is home to EKU’s Math and Statistics Department, EKU’s communication disorders program, American Sign Language and interpretation programs, and English courses.

Wallace houses two large lecture halls located on the ground floor, where students may have classes.

pins.name: Whalin Complex
pins.description:
The Whalin Technology Complex and the Central Kentucky Regional Airport are located just a few miles from campus.

Whalin is a series of buildings that houses classrooms and labs for courses that are a part of the College of Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics.

As a student, you can pursue careers in high-demand fields like aviation, applied engineering management, construction management and more.

Co-ops and internships, along with well-connected faculty, give our students a competitive edge.

Our aviation program is one of the most affordable in the nation and is the only one of its kind in Kentucky.

pins.name: Alumni Coliseum
pins.description:
The Alumni Coliseum, also known as the Paul S. McBrayer Arena, has been home to EKU Colonel basketball since the 1963-64 season and volleyball since 1991.

Alumni Coliseum seats 6,500 fans for sporting events and around 8,000 individuals for events, including graduation ceremonies.

transcripts.transcript:
So our Athletics department takes a great amount of pride in the fact that we want athletic games to be much more than just the competition. We want it to be a total campus experience, a total student experience. And so I think that you'll find that our students come out strong in full force. Our experience is very much where our fan base our students are the team behind the teams, and from the light shows, to the promos to the giveaways, everything that we do is tailored with those fans in mind. 

We don't have a dedicated athletics fee, you know, they're paying their tuition fees otherwise, but those give them credit that they can come into our games for free, as long as they're presenting a valid student ID that we can scan. Tailgating is really an extension of our games. What happens on the parking lots before games and what happens, you know, in the ravine, or what happens at that Pal Plaza, you know, all of those things are a direct part of of the type of environment type of experience that we try to create. And we know it's engaging for students andengaging for our community, and just a lot of fun, it adds to that campus experience. 

We want to be better tomorrow than we are today. We're certainly very proud of the history of success of so many of the traditions that we enjoy here. Hopefully a student-athlete who wants to come here who wants to leave a place better than they found it who wants to grow alongside an Athletics department, the programs that make it up the people that make it up. I think this is an outstanding place. We are committed to competing at the highest level of Division I and you know, being that point of pride for our community and our campus.

pins.name: Roy Kidd Stadium
pins.description:
For half a century, Roy Kidd Stadium has been a cornerstone for Eastern Kentucky University and Colonel athletics.

The stadium has been host to millions of fans, pivotal games and many campus activities.

With recent improvements, Roy Kidd Stadium is now better served to meet the needs of EKU’s student-athletes, the university and the community.

pins.name: Carloftis Gardens
pins.description:
The Carloftis Garden is located near the intersection of Lancaster and Park Drive and fronting new Martin Hall.

The Carloftis Garden is the first on any public university campus to bear the stamp of Jon Carloftis, an internationally renowned landscape designer who grew up in Rockcastle County and became known as “Gardener to the Stars.”

The Carloftis Garden is also home to the Divine Nine Plaza: a reminder to future generations of the important role that NPHC fraternities and sororities continue to play in shaping young lives.

pins.name: Student Recreation Center
pins.description:
Our brand-new Student Recreation Center provides students with everything they need to stay fit and have fun.

Exercise and get involved in a variety of ways with three hardwood multi-purpose sports courts lined for basketball and volleyball; one multi-activity gym, lined for indoor soccer, hockey, handball, basketball or volleyball; three racquetball or wallyball courts; a cardio and fitness area and an elevated indoor track.

There are also three group fitness studios where students can participate in yoga, HIIT, Zoomba and more.

We even have our own indoor/outdoor climbing bouldering center, an aquatics center, and an esports lounge.

Not to mention full locker rooms and sauna.

Fun fact! All the games are free for EKU students, and most offer free t-shirts.

pins.name: Turner Gate
pins.description:
Turner Gate is the main pedestrian entrance to the university and the beginning of a new student tradition.

All entering freshmen pass through the gate during the Big E Welcome.

Students pass the pillars of Wisdom and Knowledge, symbolizing everything they will gain from their Eastern experience.

pins.name: Whitlock Building
pins.description:
The Charles D. Whitlock Building houses all the student services you’ll need, from application to graduation.

Whitlock is home to offices such as Admissions, Financial Aid & Scholarships, Housing & Residential Life, Student Outreach & Transition, and many others.

Whether you come to campus for your first visit or a special event, your day will begin in our Welcome Center.

transcripts.transcript:
Hear at EKU we're about the transformation of lives. So many different industries, so many different sectors talk about how they can change your life with a product or service. We have the great benefit here at this institution to be able to do that for students every day. Over 60% of our students are either a low income student or a first in their family to go to college. So we are good at helping students get from where they are, to where they want to be.

I think EKU to me, means community and a home away from home. I have a dad, he's an alumni of Eastern so coming to Eastern felt like a natural choice, but initially, I was a little homesick. But I found that there was so much community here and so many people that were really invested in my journey. And it made it really easy for me to want to be here and it truly started to feel like a home away from home. It really felt like a community and a place where I was wanted and belonged and it's ended up being probably like the highlight of my life as far as college.

We're centrally located in the US. We're about an hour from from Cincinnati from Louisville. We're close to communities like Lexington, Knoxville... And there's also so much natural beauty here as we are around a lot of the most beautiful parts of the US.

Richmond itself has so much community, there's the campus life, which is amazing. And I spent a lot of my time at the ravine and the library. I mean, the campus is just absolutely gorgeous. And there's so many different places that you can go and study and be with your friends. I've been able to find like a community here in Richmond that I know I'll get to keep after I graduate.

There's no place else where you're going to find a an institution, a family of people who are going to say, "We want you to be a part of our community. To be a part of our family. And once you become a Colonel, you're a Colonel for life." While we're going to help you here in the classroom, get an amazing world class education, we're going to help you find that first job, that second job, that third job... So many people are going to build into your success, that there's no way that you can't achieve all of your hopes and dreams.

pins.name: Main Street - Richmond, KY
pins.description:
Whether you prefer the relative quiet of a small town or the buzz of a bigger city, living in Richmond offers the best of both worlds.

Richmond is a fast-growing yet quiet community where the Bluegrass region and its scenic horse farms meet the foothills of the rugged Appalachian Mountains.

Just 25 miles North, an easy drive on I-75, is Kentucky’s second-largest city: Lexington.

Other large cities within an easy two-hour drive are Louisville, Kentucky; Cincinnati, Ohio and Knoxville, Tennessee.

pins.name: Burnam Hall
pins.description:
Burnam Hall is located across the historic Ravine and close to the newly renovated Case Dining Hall and Powell Student Center.

Burnam is a unique residence hall, offering many different housing styles for students, including spaces with traditional, enhanced traditional, and suite-style options.

transcripts.transcript: The location of this historic residence hall is ideal for students who wish to have a scenic view of EKU's iconic Ravine Amphitheater. Burnham Hall is located on University Drive, just down the street from the Crabbe Library, Knoll studio, and Keene Johnson building. It's also directly next to the university's new dining center. This Residence Hall offers students spacious, traditional and suite style rooms. So everyone can find their perfect fit. In traditional style rooms, each space is equipped with two beds, two desks with chairs, and two closets. Each room includes a built in sink and vanity area. All residents on the floor share a common multiperson bathroom. In suite style rooms, each side of the suite is comfortably appointed with two beds, two desks, and two closets with four people sharing an adjoining bathroom in the middle.

pins.name: Clay Hall
pins.description:
With a welcoming lounge and a beautiful outdoor patio, Clay Hall is a great place to live at EKU.

Centrally located, Clay Hall is convenient to Case Dining Hall, Powell Student Center and the new Science Building.

Clay Hall offers enhanced traditional spaces that house two residents with a sink in the room and a community bathroom.

Enhanced traditional spaces offer affordable living in a close-knit community where students get involved and easily engage with others.

transcripts.transcript: Located in the heart of campus, Clay Hall is steps away from everything EKU students need. A quick walk will get students to the Powell Student Center, campus dining options, many academic buildings, as well as the beautiful Ravine. Clay Hall is home to residents all living in rooms shared with one roommate, and community style bathrooms. Each room has two beds, two desks, a sink, and plenty of built in storage for students. Clay Hall also boasts plenty of space for residents to gather with friends, including kitchens on each floor and a large outdoor patio.

pins.name: Eastern Scholar House
pins.description:
The Eastern Scholar House opened in the fall of 2017.

It offers a transformative experience for single parents pursuing a college education.

Located in the 800 area of Brockton, near the university’s Fitness and Wellness Center, the Scholar House is the product of a partnership between the Kentucky Housing Corporation (KHC), Kentucky River Foothills Development Council Inc. (KRFDC), the City of Richmond and EKU.

The Scholar House is a one-stop shop of services for single parents, including access to an on-site childhood development facility, counseling services, life-skills workshops, and proximity to EKU’s Student Health Services and Women’s Clinic.

pins.name: Grand Campus Apartments
pins.description:
EKU Housing & Residence Life offers apartment-style living for upperclassmen students, which includes the conveniences of campus life.

Grand Campus is a 500+ room apartment complex, open to EKU juniors, seniors and graduate students.

Grand Campus offers a beautiful on-campus location with many amenities that are not found in standard traditional Residence Halls.

transcripts.transcript: Comfortably located along Lancaster Avenue, across the street from Turner gate, and next to the historic Elmwood home, Grand Campus provides residents a bit more independence, while still enjoying the amenities and resources of on campus living. This residential community is exclusively for upper class students, and comes with an onsite gym, pool, recreational clubhouse and plenty of parking. In each Grand Campus apartment, residents have their own individual bedroom with a full size bed and personal bathroom, while sharing a kitchen, living room, laundry and outdoor patio with three other residents.

pins.name: Keene Hall
pins.description:
Located next to the EKU Center for the Arts, Keene Hall offers a convenient location to the Business & Technology Center; the College of Justice, Safety & Military Science and the Perkins Building.

With affordable living, a close-knit community and large outdoor patio spaces (including a sand volleyball court), students develop close bonds and build strong relationships.

Keene Hall offers traditional spaces housing two residents per room and offering a community bathroom.

Traditional spaces offer affordable living in a close-knit community where students get involved and easily engage with others.

transcripts.transcript: If you prefer to be part of a large bustling community, Keene Hall is the residence hall for you. Popular among students majoring in the College of Business and Technology, or Justice and Safety, this residence hall is conveniently located near the EKU Center for the Arts, the Business and Technology Center, as well as the Perkins and Stratton buildings. This Residence Hall features plenty of parking, a sand volleyball court, and is within a short walk to local Richmond restaurants and businesses. Keene Hall features traditional style rooms where each resident shares a room with two beds, two desks with chairs, and two closets with one other student, and a multi person bathroom with other residents on their floor.

pins.name: Martin Hall
pins.description:
Martin Hall is home to more than 600 students and overlooks the beautiful Carloftis Gardens, designed by nationally acclaimed rooftop garden designer John Carloftis.

Martin joins four other newly constructed residence halls, bringing the total number to 12.

This allows more than 5,000 students the opportunity to live alongside their fellow Colonels on the Campus Beautiful.

With a variety of amenities and all located within a 10-minute walk to most classes, you’re sure to find a perfect fit for you.

transcripts.transcript: If you prefer to be centrally located in the middle of all the action, New Martin Hall is the place for you. Located at Lancaster Avenue and Park Drive, New Martin Hall provides quick access to academic buildings, dining facilities, Starbucks, the Crabbe Library, the Powell Student Center, and plenty of green space. This hall has a splendid view of the Carloftis Garden, created especially for EKU by award winning garden designer John Carloftis. New Martin Hall has the capacity to house 608 residents. In the suite style rooms each space is equipped with two beds, two desks, and two closets. With four people sharing an adjoining bathroom with a dual vanity. A limited number of four person super-suites are available, featuring shared living space, a kitchenette, two full bathrooms within the suite, four beds, four closets, four desks and an additional entryway closet.

pins.name: McGregor Hall
pins.description:
Nestled in the center of campus, McGregor Hall is an exciting place to live!

McGregor is located in the center of campus, convenient to the Library, Powell Student Center, and Case Dining Hall.

McGregor Hall offers double rooms which house two residents.

The rooms are equipped with a sink and two built-in wardrobes.

Convenient community bathrooms are located on each floor.

transcripts.transcript: If you prefer to be centrally located nestled in the heart of campus, McGregor Hall is the place for you. This residence hall provides quick access to the Crabbe Library and Reading Porch, Powell Student Center, Starbucks, and academic buildings. This Residence Hall offers students large common areas great for socializing, or studying. McGregor Hall features traditional style rooms, and each room is unique with a sink in the room, and plenty of built in storage and shelving. Each resident shares a room with two beds, two desks with chairs, and two closets with one other student, and a multi person bathroom with other residents on their floor.

pins.name: North Hall
pins.description:
Situated near the Science Buildings and adjacent to South Hall, North Hall is just steps away from Case Dining Hall and the Powell Student Center.

North Hall offers simple suite spaces that house four residents between two bedrooms connected by a full bathroom.

North Hall also offers two bedrooms shared by two students who each share a bathroom.

The bedrooms are connected by a common living space and a kitchenette.

transcripts.transcript: The location of this spectacular residence hall is perfect for everyone who enjoys a scenic walk to class along beautiful tree lined streets. Situated near the new science building, you are just steps away from classrooms, Starbucks, the Powell Student Center, the Crabbe Library, and the fitness and wellness center. For sports enthusiast Roy Kidd Stadium, Alumni Coliseum, and the Samuels track are all within a short walk. North Hall is home to 488 residents who can find plenty of "me-space" with predominantly suite style rooms. Each side of the suite is comfortably appointed with two beds, two desks, and two closets. And four people sharing an adjoining bathroom with a dual vanity. Super-suites are also available for housing for people who share two full bathrooms within the super-suites along with living space that includes a kitchenette. Super-suites are furnished with four beds, four desks, and an individual closet for each resident plus an additional closet for residents to share.

pins.name: Palmer Hall
pins.description:
Palmer Hall is the perfect community for students who want a central campus location!

Located directly next to the brand-new campus recreation center and just steps from the Powell Student Center and Case Dining Hall, Palmer Hall is a perfect location to enjoy campus conveniences.

Palmer Hall offers traditional spaces which house two residents per room and offer a community bathroom.

Traditional spaces offer affordable living in a close-knit community where students get involved and easily engage with others.

transcripts.transcript:
When you come Eastern Kentucky University we love for you to like feel at home and whatever your space is for you. At each of our front desk, we have what we call a "Community Receptionist." Anytime somebody comes in, there's always someone there with like warm welcome smile, I'm able to like introduce themselves or if they have any questions or problems. On every floor, there's a Resident Advisor. So they are there as the person who checks in with your students on a pretty regular basis, whether that's week to week, day to day, it depends and they put on programs that are interest-based for them to really create the environment that like -- this is somewhere they belong to, this is somewhere they can go. When you live on campus, your commute is less than five minutes, a lot of times. And so a lot of students when you take those ATMs, it's super nice. If you're running late, you're right next door. Or if you're it's cold outside and you want to go get food or something in the cafeteria, we have plenty of options on campus for that as well. And it's never too far. 

We have about 15 Living Learning Communities give or take. They are placed in a very specific location. So for instance, we have an American Sign Language Living Learning Community, which is in Walters Hall. Students are able to sign and that's like a major slash interest-based one. Versus we have Honors Living Learning Community, which is in Martin Hall, as well as Burnham, that one is in two different halls. And so it's an opportunity for students to be able to like, make friends and be in a selective almost organization. So they have additional programming, additional resources for them to be able to get to know one another and do something that they find interesting. 

I would say mostly like living on campus provides an amazing opportunity to get to meet people because at the end of the day, you're all living together. And you all just have a camaraderie of being able to go through something that other people aren't necessarily going through at the time and you all live in the same hall, and so you know what it's like. You also have the opportunity to live near people who have the same classes as you and so you're able to provide a lot easier study groups, homework help, things like that, or you're able to interact with upperclassmen who have gone through college, so if you have any questions or anything that you can ask somebody who's been through this. It provides a whole lot more additional support that you may not be able to get if you live off-campus.

pins.name: South Hall
pins.description:
South Hall is conveniently located on Kit Carson Drive between the Science Building and North Hall.

South Hall serves as a break hall, staying open during all breaks throughout the fall, winter and spring months.

South Hall offers two floor-plan options: two bedrooms with access to a small living room/kitchenette area and shared bathroom, and four bedrooms with access to a small living room/kitchenette area and shared bathroom.

transcripts.transcript: For our upper class students, South Hall provides residents with the opportunity to have a little more space, as well as incredible indoor and outdoor spaces. Located near the New Science Building, Powell Student Center, and at the heart of campus, South Hall is a great space for our returning students. Every resident in South Hall lives in a suite style room with a common living space and individual or shared bedrooms. South Hall is also an academic year building, meaning it remains open for residents during Thanksgiving break, Winter break and Spring break.

pins.name: Sullivan Hall
pins.description:
Sullivan Hall is known for its warm and welcoming front porch.

With a beautiful view of the historic Ravine and centrally located within walking distance to Case Dining Hall, Powell Student Center and the Crabbe Library, Sullivan Hall is perfect for students who want to be in the middle of the action at EKU.

Sullivan Hall offers larger than normal traditional spaces, which house two residents per room and offers a community bathroom.

Traditional spaces offer affordable living in a close-knit community where students get involved and easily engage with others.

transcripts.transcript: If you prefer historic charm, and a tight knit community where friends can chat on the front porch, look no further than Sullivan Hall. This residence hall is the historic registry and boasts all the nostalgia of days gone by, while still having all the amenities that students are looking for today. Located on University Drive, this residence hall has a perfect view of the scenic ravine amphitheater, while only being a short walk from the Powell Students Center, Crabbe Library, Knowles studio, Keen Johnson building and the university's new dining center. Sullivan Hall offers students spacious, traditional style rooms, which are equipped with two beds, two desks with chairs, and two closets with all residents on the floor, sharing a common multi person bathroom.

pins.name: Telford Hall
pins.description:
With convenient parking and a location that overlooks the Campus Beautiful, Telford Hall is a desired community for students who want suite-style living within a close-knit community.

Telford offers traditional suite spaces where four residents share two bedrooms and a full bathroom, which connect the suite.

transcripts.transcript: One of our larger residence halls, Telford, hosts a mix of first year students and upper class students, providing a unique experience for residents. Telford is still a quick walk to the middle of campus, the caffeinated kernel, and it is also close to all that downtown Richmond has to offer. Telfer Hall residents have semi-suite style living where each resident shares a bedroom with one other resident and a bathroom with their roommate and two other students. Residents in this hall can control personal thermostats, which allow for greater comfort throughout the year. Residents also have access to multiple kitchens within the residence hall, a study lounge on each floor, and patios which are great for sitting outdoors with friends and suitemates.

pins.name: Walters Hall
pins.description:
Also known as the Ski Lodge, Walters Hall has a warm and inviting interior lobby with plenty of space for socializing, hall programs and studying.

Conveniently located next to EKU's Caffeinated Colonel Coffee Shop, Walters Hall is just a short walk to Case Dining Hall, the historic Ravine and Crabbe Library.

Walters Hall offers enhanced traditional spaces which house two residents including a sink in the room and a community bathroom.

Enhanced traditional spaces offer affordable living in a close-knit community where students get involved and easily engage with others.

transcripts.transcript: If you are looking for a quieter residence hall with lots of natural light and open space, Walters Hall is the place for you. Residents of Walters have a double room and community style bathrooms. Each room includes a built in sink and vanity area along with plenty of built in Shelves, and dressers for students. The Residence Hall also features a large lobby area, study lounge, gaming area and a quiet secluded loft. Great for conversations with friends or studying. Located a short distance from the Ravine, the caffeinated kernel, Powell Student Center, and downtown Richmond. Walters Hall is perfect for those who want to be close to the action of EKU's campus beautiful.

pins.name: Case Dining Hall
pins.description:
Case Dining Hall houses the brand-new Case Kitchen located on the second floor.

Case Kitchen features full access breakfast, lunch or dinner with international entrees, a grill, deli, salad bar and more.

Case Food Court just downstairs, is a place to meet, greet and eat between classes.

Students can dine in or take out various options: Chick-fil-A, Subway, Moe’s Southwest Grill, Panda Express and a convenient POD Market to quickly grab some things and take them back to your residence hall.

transcripts.transcript:
The dining options at the university really vary. We have Home Zone, which is your traditional kind of meat and potatoes, things that people are used to having at home. There's a grill which we're really proud of because it does feature EKU Meadowbrook farmed beef. So all the hamburger patties there are from our university farm. 

We also have the retail space, which is in lowercase that ranges anywhere from Moe's, Panda Express, Chik-fil-A -- we offer as many options as possible to as many students so that there is excitement and that it's a changing dining experience that also serves our students who are vegan or vegetarian-only giving them more options for protein besides your typical tofu and other things like that.

Colonel Cupboard is our on-campus food pantry. We provide free food and toiletry items for students who are on campus that are in need of those resources. There is a huge need for food pantries and clothing banks on campus. In our survey of college students, it was shown that 1 in 3 students do face low food insecurity. 

I think mental health is something that is really important for us to consistently keep in mind. When students are feeling well physically and mentally, that will translate into them performing better academically. So when we are able to provide students with food options or clothing that they feel comfortable in, that puts them in a better mental headspace. Kind of something they don't have to worry about knowing that this is a resource they can utilize. And then that focus is able to go back on their academics and getting good grades and achieving their goals.

pins.name: Center for the Arts
pins.description:
The EKU Center for the Arts is Central Kentucky's premier live entertainment and arts destination, located conveniently off I-75 in Richmond.

The Center for the Arts is home to premier artistic productions, community outreach opportunities and educational programming.

pins.name: Powell Student Center
pins.description:
Our Powell Student Center is home to various resources, including Student Life & First-Year Experience, the Center for Inclusive Excellence and Global Engagement (CIEGE), and our very own Vets|Ready Center for our military and veteran students.

This facility also hosts a U.S. Bank, Starbucks, spacious lounge study spaces and more.

transcripts.transcript:
The Student Rec Center is a fantastic facility, a great place on campus, and really kind of the core to our student engagement. A lot of times we think about recreation centers, it's all about kind of working out. I think one thing we've done is we've really created a hub whether it's thinking about eSports or gaming, whether it's think about climbing the rock wall, but it's become a place where students like to gather but there's there's also an element of fitness miss just a great opportunity for our students to just keep connected.

There are so many things that students can do at the Rec Center to stay active. I personally use it almost every single day. My favorite thing about the Rec Center is the rock climbing wall, I actually ended up joining a rock climbing club, which is something I never thought I would do. But it's been like one of my favorite parts of like every Tuesday night and a tradition that me and my friends have created. So, I just really liked that the Rec Center has always given me new opportunities and new ideas and ways to stay active. And if I can't think of any on my own, there's always a great staff there to help us like find new things to do.

Our first big thing for our new students is "Biggie Welcome." Once they come to campus, that's how we kick the school year off in the fall for those students. It's a great way for them to connect with their peers. They also have an upper class leader that helps guide their group around throughout that experience. And they help them form connections and bonds to the other new students. There's a variety of activities and events during that time for students to have fun, but also learn a bit more about themselves and about campus.

There are so many opportunities for students from different backgrounds to engage here in the community at Eastern. I think that that's something that I noticed about Eastern that was different than other schools is the emphasis that they put on making sure that everyone has a place and that there's somewhere for everyone to feel comfortable. I found a lot of community in the clubs that I do my interest, my faith, anything in Eastern has created just a community and a space for me to go and find people that are like me and just kind of expand my interest in those things.

pins.name: Ravine
pins.description:
We are now at an iconic EKU space, the Ravine.

This outdoor earth-carved arena is considered the heart and soul of campus.

Constructed in the 1920s, the Ravine is used for plays, concerts, classes, and Rec the Ravine, an annual event hosted by Campus Recreation.

As you can see, this space is loved by all students and used as a great relaxation space.

It's just another reason we are called the Campus Beautiful.

pins.name: Weaver Building
pins.description:
The Weaver Health Building, located conveniently across from the Whitlock Building, is primarily occupied by EKU ROTC and the exercise and sport science program.

There is an in-ground swimming pool in the basement of the Weaver Building and dance studios, a gymnasium and the Faculty Fitness and Wellness Center.

pins.name: Keen Johnson Building
pins.description:
Located in the heart of EKU’s Richmond Campus, the Keen Johnson Building plays host to numerous kinds of events.

The Ballroom and Walnut Hall are the perfect size for large social gatherings, while the East, South and West halls on the second floor are great for smaller conferences and meetings.

There is even a small performance space, the Pearl Buchanan Theater, available for small on-campus groups.

Keen Johnson is also located near EKU’s Daniel Boone statue.

Daniel Boone’s golden toe is said to give students, faculty and staff good luck.
